title: Restore dashboard readability and admin UI color differentiation

requirements.summary: Increase User Dashboard KPI card typography and vertical sizing to match the provided screenshot.
acceptanceCriteria: In the user dashboard KPI area (the 1 full-width card + 2 half-width cards), the title text is visibly larger than the current implementation and matches the relative sizing shown in Screenshot_2026-02-07-05-52-41-812_com.android.chrome.jpg.
The KPI amount text remains prominent and does not overflow or wrap on typical mobile widths.
No KPI card content is clipped; spacing between KPI cards remains consistent.

file_operations.description: Increase KPI title font sizes (full-width + half-width cards), adjust amount typography to remain prominent on mobile, and slightly increase vertical spacing (e.g., title/amount separation) to align with the screenshot.

Slightly increase KPI card padding/inner padding constants used by the KPI section (kpiCardPadding/kpiInnerPadding and related spacing helpers) so the three KPI cards render visually larger without clipping.
Verify KPI container spacing (kpiGroup* wrappers and surrounding margins) remains consistent after KPI card sizing updates, ensuring no clipping/overflow on mobile.

requirements.summary: Make the four User Dashboard action tiles ~10% smaller while improving label readability to better match the KPI section.
acceptanceCriteria: The four user dashboard action tiles are ~10% smaller compared to current (via padding/icon/text adjustments), while still readable on mobile.
Tile labels are larger than the current 'text-[9px]' feel and closer to the screenshot’s legibility, without causing label wrapping for the default labels.
Tiles keep a consistent grid layout (2x2) with even spacing and no overlap.

file_operations.description: Tune the 'small' size variant to reduce overall tile footprint (~10%) via padding/icon sizing/aspect ratio while increasing label typography from the current tiny size (avoid the 'text-[9px]' feel). Ensure labels remain single-line for default Bengali labels where possible.
Adjust the action-tile grid spacing (gap/padding wrapper) if needed to keep a stable 2x2 layout after ActionTile 'small' sizing updates, ensuring no overlap or wrapping regressions.

requirements.summary: Restore larger, consistent user/friend-facing typography across user panel views to match the updated dashboard readability.
acceptanceCriteria: User-facing text in user-related sections (where the app shows user/friend information) is increased from the current small sizing and is visually consistent with the updated dashboard typography.
No text truncation/regression is introduced in mobile layout for these sections after font-size increases.

file_operations.description: Increase small secondary text sizes (e.g., worker-name lists and supporting labels) to improve readability on mobile while preserving layout.
Increase small text sizes used in list rows/labels so the view matches the updated dashboard typography without causing overflow.
Increase note/secondary text sizing (currently very small) and ensure long notes still wrap safely on mobile.
Increase note/secondary text sizing and ensure long text remains readable and does not break card layout on mobile.
Increase user/thread list and message typography where it is currently small so user-related text remains consistent with the updated dashboard section sizing.
Audit and increase any small user profile/settings text sizing to align with the improved dashboard typography while preventing truncation on mobile.

requirements.summary: Add distinct, accessible colors to Admin System Settings tabs so each tab is clearly differentiable.
acceptanceCriteria: In System Settings, each tab trigger has a distinct color identity (background and/or text/border) that clearly differentiates it from the other tabs.
The active tab state remains clearly visible and accessible (sufficient contrast) for each tab color.
Tab layout remains usable on mobile (no overlap; labels remain readable).

file_operations.description: Apply per-tab distinct styling via TabsTrigger className (background/text/border) with a clear active state (e.g., data-[state=active]) for Branding/Labels/Notice/Admin/Section. Keep triggers readable on mobile by tuning padding/text size and adding spacing between triggers (e.g., TabsList gap) as needed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply cohesive, non-gray styling to Admin primary action buttons in Settings and Rate sections and ensure other admin sections’ primary actions are colored.
acceptanceCriteria: In System Settings, the Save buttons for Branding/Labels/Notice/Admin Credentials are visually styled with clear color (not default/gray).
In Worker Rate Settings, the primary 'Add' button is visually styled with clear color (not default/gray).
At least one primary action button in each admin section that includes a Save/Submit/Add action uses a colored style that is consistent and readable on light backgrounds.
